meanings.definition: A person regarded as despicable or contemptible.
meanings.sent1: Some people think that bullies are real dirtbags.
meanings.sent2: The community avoided the dirtbags who caused trouble.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the dirtbags tried to steal all the snacks.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest politician was a true dirtbag in disguise.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the villain was portrayed as a cunning dirtbag.

meanings.definition: A bag or container filled with dirt or soil.
meanings.sent1: The gardener carried a heavy dirtbag to plant flowers.
meanings.sent2: The dirtbag ripped open, spilling soil all over the floor.
meanings.sent3: During the race, the dirtbag burst, causing a funny mess.
meanings.sent4: She used a small dirtbag to grow tomatoes on the balcony.
meanings.sent5: The farmer bought a new dirtbag to enrich the garden soil.
